title: Guru Travels Limited | #1st Public Limited Travel in Nepal
Guru Travels Limited | #1st Public Limited Travel in Nepal
Trek to Pikey Peak 9N/10D
description: Outline Itinerary Day DAY 1: Arrival in Kathmandu and transfer to hotel Day DAY 2: : Drive from Kathmandu to Dhap Bazaar (2850m) – 8 Hours Day DAY 3: Trek from Dhap to Japre (2815m) – 14 km / 4-5 Hours Day DAY 4: Trek from Jhapre to Pikey Peak Base Camp (3640m) – 13.7 km / 5-6 Hours Day DAY 5: Hike to Pikey Peak (4065m) and Descend to Jase Bhanjyang – 5 km Day DAY 6: Trek from Jase Bhanjyang to Junbesi (2680m) – 11 km / 5-6 Hours Day DAY 7: Trek from Junbesi to Phaplu (2380m) – 13.2 km / 5-6 Hours Day DAY 8: Drive from Phaplu to Kathmandu – 9/10 Hours Day DAY 9: Final Departure from Kathmandu

itinerary.title: Day DAY
itinerary.description:
1: Arrival in Kathmandu and transfer to hotel
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Begin your trek in Nepal with a warm welcome in Kathmandu, the cultural and historical heart of the region of Nepal. Upon landing at Tribhuvan International Airport, a representative will assist you with your Nepal entry visa and transfer to your hotel. Enjoy the rest of the day exploring Thamel and preparing for your Pikey Peak adventure.

itinerary.title: Day DAY
itinerary.description:
2: : Drive from Kathmandu to Dhap Bazaar (2850m) – 8 Hours
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The drive from Kathmandu to Dhap takes you along scenic roads tracing the Sunkoshi River, leading to the beautiful village of Dhap Bazaar. This marks the start of the trekking trail in the Everest region. This drive from Kathmandu gives you the first glimpse of Nepal's countryside, terraced fields, and mountain views.

itinerary.title: Day DAY
itinerary.description:
3: Trek from Dhap to Japre (2815m) – 14 km / 4-5 Hours
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today your real trekking experience begins as you trek from Dhap to Japre, passing through remote trails and scenic ridges. This trekking route offers initial views of Everest and Numbur Himal, and your altitude gradually increases. The village of Japre features a beautiful monastery and panoramic scenery.

itinerary.title: Day DAY
itinerary.description:
4: Trek from Jhapre to Pikey Peak Base Camp (3640m) – 13.7 km / 5-6 Hours
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The trek from Jhapre to Pikey offers forested paths, yak pastures, and mani walls, leading to Pikey Peak Base Camp. As you reach Pikey base, soak in the tranquil atmosphere and prepare for the summit of Pikey Peak the next morning. This day provides the perfect mix of nature and spiritual landmarks.

itinerary.title: Day DAY
itinerary.description:
5: Hike to Pikey Peak (4065m) and Descend to Jase Bhanjyang – 5 km
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Rise early for the hike to Pikey Peak, the highest point of the journey. At the top of Pikey Peak, enjoy the stunning sunrise and the iconic view from Pikey Peak. From here, you can see Mount Everest, Kanchenjunga, Dhaulagiri, Mera Peak, and many other Himalayan giants. The panorama from Pikey Peak is truly breathtaking.

itinerary.title: Day DAY
itinerary.description:
6: Trek from Jase Bhanjyang to Junbesi (2680m) – 11 km / 5-6 Hours
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Continue your descent and trek to Junbesi, a traditional Sherpa village rich in culture. The trail passes through meadows and forests, with stops at a monastery and local tea houses. Junbesi is one of the highlights of the pikey peak trek route.

itinerary.title: Day DAY
itinerary.description:
7: Trek from Junbesi to Phaplu (2380m) – 13.2 km / 5-6 Hours
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The trek to Phaplu takes you along the valley trek route beside Junbesi Khola. The trail descends through lush terrain before reaching Phaplu, where you can enjoy local culture, sample traditional food, and relax.

itinerary.title: Day DAY
itinerary.description:
8: Drive from Phaplu to Kathmandu – 9/10 Hours
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today you conclude your trek with a scenic drive from Phaplu to Kathmandu. Once back in the city, enjoy a traditional farewell dinner to celebrate your successful days on Pikey Peak Trek.

itinerary.title: Day DAY
itinerary.description:
9: Final Departure from Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After completing your memorable Pikey Peak trek in Nepal, you will be transferred to the airport. Our team ensures a smooth send-off and wishes you well on your onward journey.

title: Muktinath Bike Tour-11N/12D
description: Ride to Mustang: 12-Day Himalayan Motorbike Adventure from KathmanduThe Journey of a LifetimeImagine this: you’re cruising through Nepal’s ever-changing landscapes on a powerful motorcycle — winding mountain roads, ancient villages, deep gorges, riverside trails, and finally, the high desert of Mustang. Each turn brings new sights, sounds, and stories. The 12-day Mustang Motorbike Tour is not just a ride; it’s an epic journey that takes you from the chaos of Kathmandu to the serenity of Muktinath, one of the most sacred sites in Nepal, and back through some of the most beautiful and lesser-known parts of the country.This route is perfect for adventure seekers who want to go beyond the usual. You'll pass through Bandipur, Kusma, Lete, Tatopani, Pokhara, and Gorkha — each place with its own charm. From cozy village stays to open roads under the shadow of Annapurna and Dhaulagiri, it’s the kind of trip that stays with you long after you’ve parked your bike.Why You’ll Love This Ride You’ll ride beside the Kali Gandaki River Gorge, the deepest in the world. Reach the spiritual site of Muktinath at nearly 3,800 meters. Soak in natural hot springs at Tatopani — a treat for your tired body. Ride through quiet apple orchards and the stunning village of Marpha. Cross hanging bridges, ride under waterfalls, and camp beneath the stars. A mix of paved highways, dirt roads, and rocky trails — enough thrill for any rider. Experience authentic Nepali culture and Tibetan-Buddhist traditions. Who Is This Trip For?If you love motorcycles, mountains, and meaningful travel — this is your trip. This tour is best suited for riders who have some off-road experience and are looking to push their boundaries. The roads can be rough, the weather can change, and the altitudes are real — but if you're up for the challenge, this will be one of the most rewarding rides you’ll ever take.Whether you're traveling solo, with friends, or as part of a riding club, this ride is for the ones who prefer the smell of dust and pine over hotel lobbies, who'd rather sip ginger tea with locals than sit in traffic. It’s not about racing — it’s about experiencing Nepal at your own rhythm, on two wheels.When to Ride: Best SeasonsThe best time to take this journey is spring (March to May) and autumn (September to November). Spring offers wildflowers, moderate temperatures, and great visibility. Autumn, right after the monsoon, provides the clearest skies and the most stunning views of the Himalayas. Avoid the monsoon season (June–August) — it brings landslides, slippery roads, and unpredictable conditions. Winters (December–February) are too cold and risky due to snow at high passes like Muktinath. Plan smart, ride smooth! What You’ll RideThe roads you’ll be covering are as diverse as the landscapes — smooth tarmac, gravel paths, dry riverbeds, steep climbs, and sharp hairpins. You’ll need a reliable, tough machine. Recommended Bikes: Royal Enfield Himalayan (411cc) – the beast for Himalayan terrain. Royal Enfield Classic 500 – great torque, classic style. Honda CRF or XR series – nimble and great for off-road. Gears to Bring:• Helmet (full-face recommended)• Armored jacket and pants• Waterproof boots and gloves• Thermal wear (for high altitudes)• Raincoat or shell layer• Hydration pack, sunglasses, sunblock, neck buff• Tool kit, flashlight, and a personal medical pouchStaying & Eating Along the WayYou’ll experience a variety of stays — from clean city hotels to warm, rustic guesthouses in the mountains. In towns like Pokhara, you’ll get modern comforts. In remote spots like Lete or Muktinath, it’s about simplicity, cozy beds, and hot soups. Food? Oh yes. Think hearty Nepali dal bhat, Thakali thalis, apple pies in Marpha, and steaming bowls of thukpa. You’ll eat like a local and love every bite.Permits & DocumentsYou’ll need a few things to make your journey legal and smooth: Annapurna Conservation Area Permit (ACAP) TIMS Card (Trekkers' Info Management System) Valid motorcycle license International Driving Permit (IDP) if you're a foreign rider Passport and visa What to Pack (Besides Gear) Passport & Permits (keep extra copies) Power bank & phone charger Sunglasses & lip balm (the sun is strong up there) Snacks like energy bars or nuts Water bottle with purification tabs Lightweight towel, earplugs (for noisy lodges) Personal medicines and altitude sickness tablets (consult doctor) Safety FirstWhile the journey is incredible, safety can’t be ignored. Your group will be supported by a backup vehicle, a mechanic, and an experienced guide trained in first aid. Ride responsibly, stay hydrated, and respect altitude. Take rest days seriously and don't ignore signs of AMS (Acute Mountain Sickness).The Mustang Motorbike Tour is not just about checking places off a list. It’s about the freedom of the open road, the hospitality of mountain people, the wisdom of old temples, and the challenge of rugged terrain. Whether you ride for the thrill, the culture, or the quiet moments by a fire, this journey delivers all that and more. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Day 1: Welcome to Kathmandu (1,400m) Day 2: Day 2: Kathmandu Heritage Ride & Bike Preparation Day 3: Kathmandu to Bandipur Day 4: Bandipur to Kusma Day 5: Kusma to Lete Day 6: Lete to Muktinath Day 7: Muktinath to Tatopani Day 8: Tatopani to Pokhara Day 9: Pokhara Sightseeing Day 10: Pokhara to Gorkha Day 11: Gorkha to Kathmandu Day 12: Departure

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Day 1: Welcome to Kathmandu (1,400m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            As your flight descends into the Kathmandu Valley, you’ll already sense the contrast—lush green hills ring the ancient city, and the chaos of Kathmandu pulses below. Our representative will greet you at Tribhuvan International Airport and transfer you to your hotel in the heart of the capital. Depending on your arrival time, you can explore the vibrant Thamel neighborhood or rest and recover from your journey. In the evening, join the team for a welcome dinner and a detailed briefing about your upcoming adventure — the route, safety protocols, and what to expect on the road.
📍Overnight: Kathmandu
 🍽 Meals: Welcome Dinner

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Day 2: Kathmandu Heritage Ride & Bike Preparation
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today’s all about orientation — both cultural and practical. After breakfast, join your guide for a short ride around Kathmandu’s cultural gems like Swayambhunath Stupa (Monkey Temple), the sacred Pashupatinath Temple, and Boudhanath Stupa. It’s a chance to ease into riding mode while soaking in Nepal’s rich spiritual heritage. In the afternoon, finalize your paperwork, check your gear, and get fitted to your motorbike. A mechanic will help you do a full technical check. Later, the group will gather for a pre-departure talk with your road captain.
📍Overnight: Kathmandu
 🍽 Meals: Breakfast

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Kathmandu to Bandipur
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Distance: ~145 km | Ride Time: 5–6 hours
Start your engines! After an early breakfast, you’ll ride out of Kathmandu and hit the Prithvi Highway. The route follows the Trishuli River, with rolling hills and terraced fields keeping you company. Take a break midway for lunch before the road winds upward to the beautifully preserved hill town of Bandipur. Once a bustling trade hub between Tibet and India, Bandipur still exudes old-world charm with its cobbled streets, restored homes, and panoramic views of Manaslu and the Annapurna range. It’s the perfect first stop to ease into the journey.
📍Overnight: Bandipur
 🍽 Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Bandipur to Kusma
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Distance: ~100 km |  Ride Time: 4–5 hours
The ride from Bandipur to Kusma is relatively short but rich in local flavor. Pass through picturesque villages, terraced farms, and mid-hill settlements. As you approach Kusma, the landscape becomes more dramatic, with deep gorges and hanging bridges. In fact, Kusma is known for having one of the world’s highest suspension bridges, stretching over the Kaligandaki Gorge. The town is calm and lesser explored, offering a peaceful overnight stop with stunning views and cultural charm.
📍Overnight: Kusma
 🍽 Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Kusma to Lete
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Distance: ~110 km |  Ride Time: 5–6 hours
Now the adventure intensifies. After breakfast, ride through Beni — the gateway to Mustang — and gradually ascend alongside the Kali Gandaki River. The tarmac gives way to gravel as the air grows thinner. This stretch offers thrilling off-road riding and raw, untouched scenery. You’ll ride under cascading waterfalls, across wooden bridges, and past wild cliffs as you approach Lete, a small settlement nestled beneath Nilgiri and Dhaulagiri. This is true Himalayan wilderness.
📍Overnight: Lete
 🍽 Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Lete to Muktinath
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Distance: ~80 km | Ride Time: 5 hours
Today, you’re riding to Mustang's spiritual core — Muktinath. Pass through Marpha, a beautiful Thakali village famous for its apple orchards and whitewashed alleys. Continue through Jomsom, the district headquarters, and begin your ascent to Muktinath at 3,800 meters. The journey is challenging, with narrow tracks, loose gravel, and alpine winds. Upon reaching, visit the revered Muktinath Temple, where 108 water taps and an eternal flame await. It’s a sacred site for both Hindus and Buddhists — a powerful place to pause and reflect.
📍Overnight: Muktinath
 🍽 Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Muktinath to Tatopani
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Distance: ~100 km | Ride Time: 5–6 hours
After an early morning walk or meditation near the temple, you’ll start your descent back through the Kali Gandaki Valley. The ride down is smoother but still thrilling — with cliffs, switchbacks, and dramatic mountain views all around. By afternoon, you’ll arrive in Tatopani, a village named after its famous natural hot springs. Dip in the warm waters and let your muscles relax — a perfect remedy after several high-altitude riding days.
📍Overnight: Tatopani

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: Tatopani to Pokhara
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Distance: ~100 km | Ride Time: 5 hours
Continue your descent into the lowlands as pine forests give way to rice terraces and colorful towns. The ride is more comfortable today as you reach Pokhara, Nepal’s most popular lakeside city. Upon arrival, settle into your hotel, take a stroll along Phewa Lake, and enjoy the luxury of paved roads and laid-back cafés. A great evening to celebrate the halfway mark of your ride.
📍Overnight: Pokhara
 🍽 Meals: Breakfast

itinerary.title: Day 9
itinerary.description:
: Pokhara Sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After a series of long riding days, today is for rest and discovery. Wake up early if you like and ride up to Sarangkot for sunrise views over the Annapurna range. Later, visit Davis Falls, the World Peace Pagoda, or Gupteshwor Mahadev Cave. You can also try paragliding, ziplining, or boating — Pokhara is the adventure capital of Nepal for good reason.
📍Overnight: Pokhara
 🍽 Meals: Breakfast

itinerary.title: Day 10
itinerary.description:
: Pokhara to Gorkha
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Distance: ~115 km | Ride Time: 5–6 hours
Leave behind the tourist buzz of Pokhara and head toward Gorkha, a historically rich town. The route cuts through peaceful rural landscapes, dotted with farming terraces and tiny tea shops. Gorkha is known as the birthplace of King Prithvi Narayan Shah, the unifier of Nepal. You can visit the Gorkha Durbar (palace) perched on a hill, offering sweeping views of the Himalayas.
📍Overnight: Gorkha
 🍽 Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

itinerary.title: Day 11
itinerary.description:
: Gorkha to Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Distance: ~135 km |Ride Time: 5–6 hours
Your last day of riding! Retrace your journey back to Kathmandu via scenic highways. As you return to the bustling city, you’ll carry with you the dust, memories, and pride of having completed one of Nepal’s most iconic bike rides. Celebrate your achievement with your fellow riders over a hearty farewell dinner.
📍Overnight: Kathmandu
 🍽 Meals: Breakfast, Farewell Dinner

itinerary.title: Day 12
itinerary.description:
: Departure
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Depending on your flight time, enjoy a final breakfast and perhaps a quick souvenir run in Thamel. Our team will drop you off at the airport with a smile and a Namaste, marking the end of your incredible Himalayan journey.
📍Overnight: —
 🍽 Meals: Breakfast

title: Haleshi Mahadev temple Tour-1N/2D
description: Setting out from Kathmandu in the early morning, embark on a picturesque 12-14 hour journey to reach the sacred destination of Haleshi Mahadev. Upon arrival in the evening, settle into accommodations nearby and immerse oneself in the serene ambiance, exploring the temple precincts. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Arrival in Haleshi Mahadev Day 2: Explore Haleshi Mahadev and Departure Kathmandu

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Haleshi Mahadev
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Depart from Kathmandu early in the morning (around 6:00 AM) by private vehicle or public bus to Haleshi Mahadev, Khotang. The journey by road takes approximately 12-14 hours, depending on road conditions and traffic. Along the way, you'll pass through beautiful landscapes, small towns, and winding mountain roads. Arrive at Haleshi Mahadev in the evening. Check-in at a guesthouse or hotel near Haleshi Mahadev temple. Spend the evening exploring the area and visiting the temple.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Explore Haleshi Mahadev  and Departure Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Wake up early and visit Haleshi Mahadev temple for morning prayers and meditation. After breakfast, explore the surroundings and visit other nearby attractions such as Maratika Cave (Halesi Cave) and Siddha Baba Mandir. Depart from Haleshi Mahadev by midday for the return journey to Kathmandu. Arrive back in Kathmandu in the late evening.

title: Paragliding , Hot Air Balloon and Bungee in Pokhara-1N/2D
description: Embarking on an adventure-packed journey, the itinerary begins with a morning flight from Kathmandu to Pokhara. Day one unfolds with exhilarating activities in Pokhara, including paragliding and a serene hot air balloon ride over the picturesque cityscape. Leisure time allows exploration of Pokhara's attractions and dining experiences by Phewa Lake. Day two brings the thrill of bungee jumping in Pokhara before embarking on a scenic road trip back to Kathmandu. En route, a stop in the charming town of Bandipur offers cultural immersion amidst historic sites and local cuisine. As the sun sets, the journey concludes in Kathmandu, leaving behind memories of adrenaline-fueled adventures and cultural discoveries. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Arrival in Pokhara Day 2: Bungee Jumping and Departure from Pokhara

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Pokhara
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Depart from Kathmandu early in the morning for your domestic flight to Pokhara. Enjoy the short and scenic flight, taking in aerial views of the majestic Himalayas and lush landscapes below.

Mid-morning: Arrival in Pokhara
Arrive in Pokhara and transfer to your hotel near Pokhara Lakeside. Check into your accommodation and take some time to freshen up before starting your day's adventures.

Late Morning/Early Afternoon: Paragliding and Hot Air Balloon Ride
Head to Sarangkot for your thrilling paragliding adventure. Meet your experienced pilot and take off for a tandem flight over Pokhara Valley, enjoying panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and Phewa Lake. After paragliding, indulge in a serene hot air balloon ride over Pokhara, drifting gently through the sky and capturing breathtaking views of the city and its surroundings.

Afternoon: Explore Pokhara
Spend the afternoon exploring Pokhara at your leisure. Visit attractions such as Phewa Lake, where you can enjoy a boat ride or simply relax by the lakeside. Explore the colorful streets of Lakeside, dotted with shops, cafes, and souvenir stalls. Optionally, visit the International Mountain Museum to learn about the culture, history, and wildlife of the Himalayas.

Evening: Dinner and Leisure Time
Enjoy dinner at one of the many restaurants in Pokhara, offering a variety of cuisines ranging from Nepali to international. After dinner, you can relax at a lakeside cafe or take a leisurely stroll along the shore of Phewa Lake, soaking in the serene atmosphere.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Bungee Jumping and Departure from Pokhara
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Start your day with an adrenaline-pumping bungee jumping experience at the High Ground Bungee in Pokhara. Feel the thrill of free-falling from a height of 70 meters and bouncing back up, surrounded by stunning natural scenery. After bungee jumping, return to your hotel to freshen up and check out.
Midday: Road Journey from Pokhara to Kathmandu via Bandipur
Depart from Pokhara around midday for your road journey back to Kathmandu. En route, stop in Bandipur, a charming hilltop town known for its preserved Newari architecture and panoramic views of the Himalayas. Explore Bandipur's historic streets, visit cultural landmarks such as the Khadga Devi Temple and Tundikhel viewpoint, and enjoy lunch at a local eatery.

Afternoon: Continue Journey to Kathmandu
Resume your journey to Kathmandu after exploring Bandipur. Arrive in Kathmandu by late afternoon or early evening, depending on traffic and road conditions.

title: Kulekhani Dam, Markhu, and Chitlang-1N/2D
description: OverviewThis 2-day escape to Kulekhani Dam, Markhu, and Chitlang Trip is perfect for travelers seeking peace, culture, and nature without the crowds. Swap Kathmandu’s noise for serene lakeside walks, village life, and organic farm tours. In just two days, you’ll experience Nepal’s diverse beauty: paddle on Kulekhani Lake’s mirror-like waters, chat with farmers in Markhu, and explore Chitlang’s 19th-century monastery. The trip is designed for everyone—solo travelers, couples, families, or seniors—with no special skills or gear required. Enjoy slow travel as you taste fresh fish from the lake, try homemade goat cheese, and learn about Newari traditions. By staying in local guesthouses, you directly support villagers while immersing yourself in their daily rhythms. Photographers will love capturing golden sunsets over the lake, terraced farms, and prayer flag-strewn monasteries. History fans can explore into Nepal’s hydropower legacy at Kulekhani Dam or Chitlang’s role as a historic trade hub. Affordable, eco-friendly, and flexible, this trip lets you unplug, recharge, and return with stories of buffalo herds grazing by the water, organic strawberries plucked straight from fields, and warm smiles from locals. It’s not just a escape—it’s a chance to see Nepal through the eyes of its people, all within a short drive from the capital.Top Scenic Sights & Experiences Kulekhani Lake Reflections: Perfect mirror-like water with hills in the background.Markhu’s Rural Charm: Stone houses, terraced farms, and goats grazing by the lake.Chitlang’s Green Valleys: Rolling farms, forest trails, and misty mountain views.Chitlang Monastery: Visit this 19th-century Buddhist site adorned with prayer flags. Feel the peace as monks chant prayers.Local Food Adventures: Fresh fish, organic cheese, and Newari treats.Why You’ll Love This Trip?Affordable: Costs less than a weekend in a Kathmandu hotel.Unique stories: Return home with tales of cheese-making monks and lakeside sunsets.Green travel: Eco-friendly stays and low environmental impact.This trip is a chance to experience Nepal like never before. In Chitlang, stroll through organic farms, taste fresh goat cheese, and hike to hilltops for breathtaking views of the Himalayan foothills. At Kulekhani Dam and Markhu, enjoy the blue lake surrounded by pine forests, with options for a boat ride and peaceful walks. Meet friendly locals, explore the small market, and watch farmers herd goats and buffalo by the lake. This isn’t just a vacation – it’s an opportunity to connect with nature, local culture, and create unforgettable memories away from the usual hustle and bustle. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Kathmandu → Kulekhani Dam → Markhu Day 2: Markhu → Chitlang → Kathmandu

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Kathmandu → Kulekhani Dam → Markhu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Start your day with a scenic drive from Kathmandu, departing at 7:00 AM in a private vehicle. As you leave the city behind, enjoy the views of terraced farms, winding rivers, and misty hills. By 10:30 AM, you'll arrive at Kulekhani Dam, Nepal's first hydropower project, where you can take in the impressive surroundings.
For lunch, head to a lakeside restaurant around 1:00 PM and indulge in local delicacies like freshly caught fried fish from Kulekhani Lake or a comforting plate of dal bhat (rice with lentils). After lunch, drive 30 minutes to Markhu, a charming village nestled beside the lake, where you'll arrive by 2:00 PM.
In the evening, check into a cozy guesthouse or homestay around 5:30 PM. As the golden hour approaches, take in a breathtaking sunset that paints the lake and surrounding hills in warm hues. For dinner, enjoy traditional dishes like gundruk (fermented greens) or sel roti (sweet rice bread) around 7:00 PM. Fall asleep to the sound of crickets and wake up to stunning mountain views the next morning.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Markhu → Chitlang → Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Start your morning with a hearty breakfast at 7:00 AM, featuring fresh milk, eggs, or roti (flatbread) to fuel you for the day. By 8:00 AM, embark on a one-hour drive to Chitlang, a historic Newari village rich in culture and tradition.
For lunch, around 12:30 PM, indulge in Newari specialties like bara (lentil pancake) or yomari (sweet rice dumplings), which offer a delicious taste of the local cuisine. After lunch, at 2:00 PM, begin your return journey to Kathmandu. As you drive back, enjoy the beautiful scenery of villages, forests, and rivers, with the sun setting behind the hills, creating a serene atmosphere.
By 6:00 PM, you’ll arrive in Kathmandu, feeling refreshed and full of memories from your peaceful and scenic adventure.

title: Annapurna Basecamp Trek For Indian -10Days/9Nights
description: Annapurna Base Camp Trek - 10N/9DTrip Overview: Are you looking to explore the stunning Annapurna Base Camp but don't have much time? Don't worry! We've designed an Annapurna Basecamp Trek - 10Days/ 9Nights trek that lets you enjoy the beauty of this Himalayan spot even if you're short on time. This Annapurna Base camp Trek - 10Days/9Nights is perfect for those who love mountains but can't stay long in Nepal. Join us as we go through the full schedule, helpful tips, and answers to common questions about this amazing journey.Come along on our exciting 10-day trip to Annapurna Base Camp, located 4,130 meters (13,550 feet) above sea level, right beneath the towering Mount Annapurna, which reaches an incredible 8,091 meters (26,545 feet).Our trek is a 10 Days adventure to get you through some of the most beautiful terrains, commencing as well as finishing at Pokhara. You will be trekking amongst the highest mountains on Earth such as Gangapurna (7,454 meters/24,455 feet), Machhapuchhre (6,997 meters/22.956 feet) and Hiuchuli (6.441 metres / 21.131).The Annapurna Range encompasses all 6 peaks over 7000m, with the highest peak being that of Annapurna I (8th tallest mountain in the world at an elevation of reaching 8091 metes. We could see some of the most beautiful mountains on this planet and you will get to witness them with us while trekking for 10 days.We also pass through the verdant habitat and sheltered primeval forests of the Annapurna Conservation Area, which guarantees many rare creatures such as red pandas & Himalayan animals.You will find the enormous peaks of the Himalayas soaring above you presenting stunning panoramic views for your entire journey. You can experience all of the fun and beauty, without worrying about where free from the burden of dealing with all the little details.Even if you are travelling to Nepal for the first time, be at peace Guru Travels Nepal will take away all issues related from landing in Kathmandu or Pokhara throughout your travel support and permit trekking that includes food and accommodation.If you want to book our Annapurna Basecamp Trek - 10Days/ 9Nights you can now book for 2024 and 2025! We can also customize the package to match your schedule, budget, and endurance level. If you have any questions about the cost or details of the Annapurna Base Camp, please feel free to contact us.Highlights : The amazing 360° views and beautiful sunrise seen from Annapurna Base Camp Inspiring waterfalls and rivers that flow by the glacier fed river. Enjoy the magical moment when the sun sets behind those huge snowy mountains such as Annapurna, Machapuchhre (Fishtail) and Gangapura. Take a thrilling walk across colourful rhododendron and bamboo wood forest leading you to the base of 10th highest mountain in the world. Learning about the traditions and culture of the Gurung people in the village of Ghandruk. Hiking through forests filled with bright red rhododendrons in the spring. Best Season for Annapurna Base Camp TrekFor the Annapurna Base Camp trip, the best times to go on a trip in Nepal are spring and fall. We advise spring and autumn, considering that at those times of year the paths and teahouses will be somewhat busy. On the route, however, this also fosters togetherness and new connections made late evenings.Spring (March until May):Perfect time to enjoy the milder temperature and explore the rhododendron woodlands with their vibrant blossoms. Hiking is rather nice as the season goes on since the lower altitudes get warmer weather.Autumn (September – November):Another outstanding season is this one. Though generally it resembles spring, it can start out a little wet when the monsoon ends. Monsoon (June – September):The monsoon season runs from June to September and may bring regular rainy spells. You might be unlucky and it will rain every day; you might be lucky and find minimal rain on your path. One cannot forecast the precise weather. All the same, you will have to pack waterproof clothes and be ready for rain. Slippery paths and limited view are two further drawbacks of the monsoon. Positively, even if more difficult, this is an adventurous experience and the paths will have less walkers. Winter (December–February): If you are an experienced trekker and if you do not mind of the cold and snow, we would advise just contemplating winter in this region. Particularly at night, temperatures will be somewhat low. Snow would prevent us from camping at base camp in the winter. If you truly wish to go trekking in the winter, these are the seasons to go; it will not be as cold in the first half of December and the later half of February. Remember that the weather can cause adjustments to the schedule. The best periods to receive clear mountain vistas, blue sky, and pleasant weather, we advise spring and fall. At Annapurna Base Camp, the springtime temperatures range from 19oC to - 9oC with an average daily temperature of about 10 degrees. Early fall also features comparable temperatures. Remember that at the lower altitudes, it will be somewhat warm and sunny during the day; hence, sunscreen and a sunhat are advised. At night, tempers can drop to almost 0 centigrade. Annapurna Base Camp Trek Difficulty The Annapurna Base Camp (ABC) Trek is an adventure geared to anyone of moderate fitness, or even little trekking experience. The trail will see you right deep in the Annapurna range where you are treated to stunning views and a real taste of trekking in Nepal. It is not so difficult track but you must be familiar with routes of this region and altitude.There are two main things that make the ABC Trek easy — one is, of course, its difficulty level. It is a moderate trek with rocky,paved as well muddy trails, more frequent in rainy season. The trekking slowly goes up to the greater elevations, you will be at crucial altitudes for only two days — Deurali 3230 meters /10597 feet and Annapurna Base Camp-4130 meters/13549 feet. This gives plenty of time for the thinner oxygen levels to acclimatize, which helps prevent altitude sickness. General hiking times of about 5 hours per day with one longer day up to maximum 8 hours.Temperature wise when you are on the trek it varies from 12 – 22 Degrees Celsius at lower levels to 5-10 Degrees at Annapurna Base Camp which is quite low. But the weather during monsoon and winter months can change all of a sudden, so you should be prepared.The hike itself is moderate difficulty and good for families; however it does require a certain level of physical fitness so be cautious regarding your own limitations! High altitudes and uneven terrain could make it difficult for people with asthma or other health problems. Unless you are one to worry, better look for alternative treks in this region — like Poonhill Ghorepani Trek or Mardi Himal Trek. Before you go on the famous Annapurna Base Camp Trek, you should learn more about these things. They will leave a lasting impression on you. Annapurna Base Camp Trek - 10Days/9Nights Food While trekking to Annapurna Base Camp, you’ll have the chance to enjoy traditional Nepalese food as well as popular international dishes like Tibetan, Continental, Italian, and Indian cuisine. Breakfast and dinner will be provided at the teahouses where you stay overnight, while lunch will be served on the way to your next destination. All meals during the trek are included, but in Kathmandu and Pokhara, only breakfast will be provided.For breakfast on the trek, you might have options like Tibetan bread, chapati, French toast, cornflakes, hash browns, eggs (fried, scrambled, or boiled), pancakes, porridge, muesli, vegetable dishes, and various hot drinks.Lunch choices include thukpa (noodle soup), dal bhat (lentils and rice), momos (dumplings), Tibetan bread, macaroni, spaghetti, sherpa stew, steaks, potatoes, sandwiches, rice with curry, spring rolls, burgers, pizza, yak steak, and desserts.Dinner menus typically offer dishes like momos, thukpa, dal bhat, chapati, macaroni, spaghetti, sherpa stew, a variety of soups, steaks, potato dishes, sandwiches, pizza, ramen soup, burgers, yak steak, desserts, and both hot and cold drinks.Annapurna Base Camp Trek - 10Days/9Nights AccommodationThe Annapurna region is a popular trekking destination in Nepal. All you have to do is trek and keep on walking because there are lots of tea houses out there in the ABC Trekking Route, so tent will be useless! People are accommodated in standard yet comfortable rooms to be shared by two. During your 14-day trek, you will be staying at the best available tea houses as promised by Guru Travels Limited. Rooms are usually double-bedded ones with wooden beds, bed sheets and blankets, mattresses, pillows or cushions at every nook but most of the places it also has attached bathroom although same is not guaranteed everywhere. Single rooms can be organized in almost all areas except at Deurali and Annapurna Base Camp. At lower altitudes it is easier to get single rooms, especially Kathmandu and the trekking regions below, but as we head higher upwards so this could be harder. Outline Itinerary Day 01: Arrival at Kathmandu and sightseeing Day 02: Drive to Pokhara or fly to Pokhara (820m) Day 03: Drive to Naya pool and trek to Ghandurk (1,940m) Day 04: Trek to Chhomrong (2,170m) Day 05: Trek from Chhomrong to Dovan (2,820m) Day 06: Trek from Dovan to Annapurna Base Camp (4,130m) Day 07: Descend from Annapurna Base Camp to Bamboo (2,815m) Day 08: Trek from Bamboo to Siwai and Drive back to Pokhara (820m) Day 09: Fly from Pokhara to Kathmandu (1350m) Day 10: Drive back to Kathmandu

itinerary.description:
: Arrival at Kathmandu and sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            As per flight time, our representative will be there at airport  for pick up and drop you to the hotel. After refreshment  proceed for the sightseeing tour of Pasupatinath Temple 
and Swyambhunath stupa. During Free time you can roam  around Thamel market for shopping. Overnight at Kathmandu.

Accommodation: 3-star Hotel

itinerary.description:

                                                            Today you will be received by a driver and will be driving to  Pokhara. Upon arrival we will be checking-in in the property reserved. After a short refreshment in the property you will have 
the rest of the day to yourself during which you can walk around Lakeside or enjoy the nightlife of Pokhara.

Meals: Dinner
Accommodation: 3-star Hotel

itinerary.title: Day 03
itinerary.description:
: Drive to Naya pool and trek to Ghandurk (1,940m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After morning breakfast, we will drive to Naya Pool (2 – 3 hour approx). We will take a short break have a meal, stretch up and get going. Being the first day we will be doing a short trek to 
get use to the terrain. After a trek of approximately an hour or two we will be able to get to Ghandruk, a beautiful village mostly inhabited by the Gurung community. We will be staying the night at Ghandruk homestay.

Accommodation: Teahouse

itinerary.description:
: Trek to Chhomrong (2,170m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After a refreshing breakfast we will continue our trek. We descend for a while before making a pleasant ascent to  Chhomrong from Kimrong Khola after another arduous trek to Chere Danda. Great views of Gangapurna, Hiunchuli, Fishtail Mountain (Machhapuchhre), and Annapurna South are available as we travel. We make a rapid descent to reach the Kimrong Khola.

Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner
Accommodation: Teahouse

itinerary.title: Day 05
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Chhomrong to Dovan (2,820m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            We move through a wet, damp bamboo woodland before making a steady ascent with a few steep stretches. The forest only opens up and we are  once more outside in the sunshine with 
breathtaking views of the glacier river below once we reach Himalaya Hotel.
Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner
Accommodation: Teahouse

itinerary.title: Day 06
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Dovan to Annapurna Base Camp (4,130m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Carefully ascend through a riverside and then cross a rocky trail to reach the hillside. It's a 
moderately challenging hike from Bagar to Machhapuchhre Base Camp. It is undoubtedly a 
pleasant experience to see the spectacular Machhapuchhre, Mt. Hiunchuli, Annapurna 
South, Annapurna I, Annapurna III, Gandharvachuli, and Gangapurna from Machhapuchhre base camp.
Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner
Accommodation: Teahouse

itinerary.title: Day 07
itinerary.description:

                                                            We reverse our route back to Bamboo after leaving the Annapurna base camp. The journey 
today is downhill, so it shouldn't be too challenging. In addition, we will always have the 
magnificent scenery to lighten the mood.
Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner
Accommodation: Teahouse

itinerary.title: Day 08
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Bamboo to Siwai and Drive back to Pokhara (820m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            We have the opportunity to take in the breathtaking western Nepali hill scenery as we trek down to Siwai. After a short walk we will get to the bus stop where our ride will be waiting for us and we will drive back Pokhara. Upon arrival we will be checking into the hotel and get refreshed. We will be having our lunch and going for a sightseeing of magestic Pokhara. 
Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner
Accommodation: Teahouse

itinerary.title: Day 09
itinerary.description:
: Fly from Pokhara to Kathmandu (1350m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today after a lovely breakfast in the hotel. As per our flight time, we will be flying or 
driving back to kathmandu and sightseeing tour of Bouddhanath stupa and Patan Durbar 
square. Overnight at kathmandu.
Meals: Breakfast, and Dinner
Accommodation: 3-star Hotel or Similar

itinerary.title: Day 10
itinerary.description:
: Drive back to Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, as per flight timing proceed towards international airport for flight back to home with the beautiful memories of Nepal 
tour.

title: Ama Yangri-2 Days/1 Night
description: Ama Yangri is located something about 90km north of Kathmandu Valley which is highest peak that is nearest from the Captial City Kathmandu. Ama Yangri is an area inhabited by Sherpas, Tamangs and Chhetries under Helambu Circuit trekking which is one of the famous destinations for the travellers which lies in the Sindupalchok district under the Langtang National park. Helambu Circuit Trekking also well-known as “Hyolmo Heritage” is an easy, natural and geographically fascinating trekking tour that visitors can experience the mountains of Majestic Himalayan scenery, great opportunity to experience Green Landscapes and unique Hyolmo Culture. It is naturally and geographically fascinating trekking tour that travelers can experience the mountains of Majestic Himalayan scenery, great opportunity to experience Green Landscapes and Hyolmo culture. From low altitudes, we have excellent views of mountains that include the Langtang Range, the Annapurnas, Manaslu and even Everest on a clear day. The language, culture and dress of the Helambhu Sherpas are very different from those who live in Khumbu area and Rolwaling. The region is very famous place for Thanka arts. description: Thailand & Bali Tour Package Overview 8N/ 9D Experience the tropical wonders of Southeast Asia with our carefully crafted Thailand & Bali 8 Nights / 9 Days Tour Package. Whether you’re drawn to island adventures, exotic temples, or romantic sunsets, this package invites you to explore two world-renowned destinations—each with its own rhythm, flavor, and charm. Begin your adventure in Thailand, where you’ll dive into the dynamic coastal city of Pattaya and explore the cultural heart of Bangkok. From speedboat rides to Coral Island and bustling street markets to glittering temples, Thailand will captivate your senses with its bold character and rich traditions. Then, fly to Bali, Indonesia, a land steeped in spirituality and natural beauty. Surrounded by rice terraces, volcanoes, and cliffside ocean temples, you’ll find balance and inspiration in every direction. Whether you're soaking in Ubud’s calm or chasing sunsets along Bali’s scenic coastlines, this tropical paradise will leave you enchanted. This package is ideal for travelers seeking the perfect mix of cultural immersion, coastal relaxation, and tropical elegance. Package Highlights - Spend 4 Nights in Thailand (Pattaya & Bangkok) - Spend 4 Nights in Bali (Seminyak / Ubud) - Seamless Travel Between Countries What’s Included - International and regional flights (Bangkok–Bali) - 4 nights hotel accommodation in Thailand (2 nights Pattaya + 2 nights Bangkok) - 4 nights hotel accommodation in Bali (Seminyak or Ubud area) - Daily breakfast at all properties - Coral Island tour with lunch in Pattaya - Bangkok half-day city tour with guide - Full-day Kintamani & Ubud tour in Bali Ideal For - Honeymooners looking for romance and natural beauty - Families seeking both guided adventure and downtime - Solo travelers and friends desiring a well-balanced tropical escape - Culture seekers eager to explore two distinct yet harmonious destinations Duration 8 Nights / 9 Days Total Thailand: 4 Nights (2 in Pattaya, 2 in Bangkok) Bali (Indonesia): 4 Nights (customizable stay in Seminyak, Ubud, or Nusa Dua) Visa Information Traveling to Thailand and Bali is smooth and tourist-friendly. Nepali citizens and most international travelers are eligible for Visa on Arrival in Thailand, allowing 15 days of stay with minimal paperwork at the airport. Indonesia also provides a 30-day Visa on Arrival for Nepali citizens and many other nationalities upon landing in Bali. Both countries offer quick, straightforward entry processes that make your vacation planning easy and efficient. Accommodations Your stay will feature a handpicked selection of premium hotels and resorts combining comfort, location, and style. In Thailand, enjoy modern accommodations in Pattaya and Bangkok, close to the beach, shopping districts, and cultural landmarks. In Bali, relax in scenic boutique resorts or tranquil private villas with lush surroundings, spa access, and optional upgrades for honeymoon suites or private pools. Every property is selected to reflect the essence of each destination while ensuring a restful and memorable stay. Customization Options At Guru Travels Limited, we understand that every traveler has unique expectations, which is why this Thailand–Bali itinerary is completely customizable. Whether you wish to extend your stay in either destination, upgrade to luxurious villas, include adventure activities like scuba diving or island-hopping, or enjoy romantic add-ons such as candlelight beach dinners and private photo sessions, we’ll tailor the experience to match your preferences. From wellness spa packages to private tours and airport fast-track services, our travel experts ensure your journey is not just a holiday—but your personal story brought to life. 📞 Contact us: +977-9851334626 | Email | Instagram | Facebook | Tiktok Let Guru Travels turn your dream vacation into reality—connect with us today! title: Bali & Singapore Tour Package-6N/7D
description: This 7-day itinerary takes you from Bali’s vibrant culture to Singapore’s modern attractions, blending relaxation and excitement. Start in Bali with visits to iconic sites like Mount Batur and Tanah Lot Temple, along with thrilling water sports. Transition to Singapore, where you’ll explore Gardens by the Bay, take in city landmarks, and experience the fun at Sentosa Island’s SEA Aquarium and Wings of Time show. Cap off the adventure with a full day at Universal Studios, enjoying rides and attractions inspired by famous films. This trip offers a perfect mix of culture, adventure, and world-class sightseeing. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Arrival in Bali Day 2: Barong Kintamani Tour Day 3: Water Sports & Tanah Lot Temple Day 4: Arrival in Singapore Day 5: Singapore City Tour & Sentosa Island Day 6: Universal Studios Singapore Day 7: Departure to Nepal

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Bali
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Welcome to Bali! After clearing immigration and customs, you’ll be transferred to your hotel. Once checked in, relax and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight stay at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Barong Kintamani Tour
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, depart around 8:30 a.m. for an exciting Barong Dance performance at Batubulan, a traditional dance that tells the story of good versus evil through unique costumes and masks. Next, travel to Kintamani for breathtaking views of Mount Batur and Lake Batur, where you’ll also enjoy lunch. In the afternoon, visit the famous Goa Gajah, or "Elephant Cave." Return to the hotel in the evening.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Water Sports & Tanah Lot Temple
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Begin the day with breakfast, followed by a thrilling water sports session at Tanjung Benoa. Try parasailing, a banana boat ride, and jet skiing (accompanied by an instructor for safety). After refreshing back at the hotel, visit the iconic Tanah Lot Temple on Bali’s west coast. Enjoy the sunset view over the ocean before returning to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Singapore
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, transfer to the airport for your flight to Singapore. Upon arrival, you’ll be taken to your hotel. Spend the rest of the day exploring Singapore’s vibrant sights at your own pace.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Singapore City Tour & Sentosa Island
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Start the day with breakfast, then embark on a half-day city tour of Singapore. Visit Gardens by the Bay, with its incredible indoor Cloud Forest and Flower Dome. Continue to the iconic Merlion Statue for photos with the Marina Bay backdrop, and explore China Town for unique souvenirs. In the afternoon, head to Sentosa Island for the ultimate experience, including SEA Aquarium, Skyride and Luge, and a dazzling “Wings of Time” laser and fireworks show.

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Universal Studios Singapore
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, spend the day at Universal Studios Singapore. Enjoy exciting rides and attractions based on hit movies and shows, including Transformers 3D, Shrek 4D, Revenge of the Mummy, and Battlestar Galactica.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Departure to Nepal
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Enjoy breakfast, then check out and transfer to the airport for your flight back to Nepal.

title: Rotary Convention Canada 2025
description: Ultimate Canada Rotary Tour (11N/12D) Explore Calgary, Banff & Jasper with Guru Travels Ltd.Embark on an extraordinary journey with Guru Travels Ltd. on the Ultimate Canada Rotary Tour (11N/12D), starting at NPR 5,25,000 per person. Designed for Rotarians and travelers looking to experience the Rotary Convention 2025 in Calgary, this package combines the excitement of Rotary International events with the breathtaking beauty of Canada’s iconic destinations: Calgary, Banff, and Jasper. Begin your adventure with the Rotary Convention in Calgary from June 21–25, where you’ll connect with Rotarians globally, attend sessions led by Global Rotary Speakers, and build connections at the “House of Friendship.” Calgary’s rich cultural attractions, including the Calgary Stampede and Calgary Tower, provide a glimpse into Canada’s heritage, making this the ideal start to a memorable journey.After the convention, immerse yourself in the scenic wonders of Canada with guided tours from Calgary to Banff. Experience the stunning Banff Gondola Ride and explore the serene landscapes of Banff National Park. Your adventure continues in Jasper, where you’ll witness the pristine beauty of Jasper National Park, the mesmerizing Columbia Icefields, and the panoramic Glacier Skywalk. Cap off your journey with a Lake Minnewanka Cruise to fully experience the natural wonders of Canada. Each day offers a blend of Rotary Convention activities and exploration, balancing meaningful connections with the Global Rotary Community and immersion in Canada’s diverse landscapes.Why Choose Guru Travels Ltd.? As Nepal’s first public limited travel company, Guru Travels Ltd. is dedicated to providing a trusted and seamless travel experience. This Canada Rotary package includes 3-star accommodations, daily breakfast, airport transfers, and professional English-speaking guides to ensure your comfort. We also handle visa processing and airfare assistance for a worry-free journey, so you can focus entirely on the experience. Join us for the Ultimate Canada Rotary Tour to make lifelong memories and explore the best of Rotary in Canada. Limited spots available—book now by contacting us at 01-4543567 | 9851334626 Outline Itinerary Day 1: Friday, June 20, 2025 – Arrival in Calgary Day 2: Saturday, June 21, 2025 – Calgary City Tour Day 3: Sunday, June 22, 2025 – Rotary Convention Day 4: Monday, June 23, 2025 – Calgary Stampede & Calgary Tower Day 5: Tuesday, June 24, 2025 – Heritage Village & Gasoline Alley Museum Day 6: Wednesday, June 25, 2025 – Travel to Banff Day 7: Thursday, June 26, 2025 – Banff Gondola Ride Day 8: Friday, June 27, 2025 – Travel to Jasper Day 9: Saturday, June 28, 2025 – Columbia Icefields & Skywalk Day 10: Sunday, June 29, 2025 – Jasper National Park Day 11: Monday, June 30, 2025 – Lake Minnewanka Cruise Day 12: Tuesday, July 1, 2025 – Departure from Jasper

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Friday, June 20, 2025 – Arrival in Calgary
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Arrive at Calgary Airport and transfer to the Best Western Premier Freeport Inn Calgary Airport. After checking in, enjoy a relaxing evening with dinner at an Indian restaurant. This is a great time to unwind after your flight and settle in for the adventure ahead. Overnight stay at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Saturday, June 21, 2025 – Calgary City Tour
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Begin the day with breakfast at the hotel, followed by a guided tour of Calgary, exploring the city’s major landmarks. You'll have free time for lunch on your own, allowing you to sample local flavors. The day concludes with dinner at an Indian restaurant and a comfortable overnight stay at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Sunday, June 22, 2025 – Rotary Convention
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, head to the Rotary Convention for a full day of events and networking. Lunch will be on your own during the convention, with plenty of options available. In the evening, gather for dinner at an Indian restaurant before returning to the hotel for the night.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Monday, June 23, 2025 – Calgary Stampede & Calgary Tower
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Following breakfast, spend the day at Calgary Stampede, one of the most iconic events in Canada. Later, visit the Calgary Tower for a stunning view of the city. Afterward, enjoy dinner at an Indian restaurant before settling in for the night at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Tuesday, June 24, 2025 – Heritage Village & Gasoline Alley Museum
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Start with breakfast at the hotel, then head to Heritage Park Historical Village and the Gasoline Alley Museum. These sites offer a glimpse into Canada’s history and heritage. After exploring, have lunch on your own before dinner at an Indian restaurant, followed by another overnight stay in Calgary.

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Wednesday, June 25, 2025 – Travel to Banff
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, check out from your Calgary hotel and head toward Banff. The scenic drive will offer beautiful views along the way. Once in Banff, check in at Canmore Inn & Suites and enjoy dinner at an Indian restaurant. Relax and settle in for your stay in the charming town of Banff.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Thursday, June 26, 2025 – Banff Gondola Ride
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Enjoy breakfast at the hotel before embarking on the Banff Gondola ride, offering panoramic views of the stunning Canadian Rockies. You’ll have lunch on your own during the day before wrapping up with dinner at an Indian restaurant. Spend the night at your hotel in Banff

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: Friday, June 27, 2025 – Travel to Jasper
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, check out from Banff and travel to Jasper. This scenic journey will take you through some of the most picturesque landscapes in Canada. Upon arrival, check in at the Lobstick Lodge, followed by dinner at an Indian restaurant and a restful night.

itinerary.title: Day 9
itinerary.description:
: Saturday, June 28, 2025 – Columbia Icefields & Skywalk
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Start the day with breakfast, then head to the Columbia Icefields for an unforgettable adventure. Experience the Glacier Skywalk, a breathtaking viewpoint over the vast icefields. Lunch will be on your own before a group dinner at an Indian restaurant and an overnight stay at the hotel in Jasper.

itinerary.title: Day 10
itinerary.description:
: Sunday, June 29, 2025 – Jasper National Park
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, explore Jasper National Park, one of the largest and most beautiful national parks in the world. Spend the day surrounded by nature, with lunch on your own, and end the evening with dinner at an Indian restaurant before returning to the hotel for the night.

itinerary.title: Day 11
itinerary.description:
: Monday, June 30, 2025 – Lake Minnewanka Cruise
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Following breakfast, embark on a serene cruise across Lake Minnewanka, enjoying the tranquility and scenic views. Lunch will be on your own before gathering for dinner at an Indian restaurant. Spend your final night in Jasper at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 12
itinerary.description:
: Tuesday, July 1, 2025 – Departure from Jasper
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, check out of the hotel and prepare for your journey back home. You will be transferred to the airport for your departure, marking the end of this incredible 12-day Canadian adventure.

title: Lhasa City Tour -3N/4D
description: Experience the magic of Tibet in our 4 Days Lhasa City Tour. Begin with a scenic flight from Kathmandu to Lhasa, where you'll explore iconic sites such as the Potala Palace, a monumental structure of immense cultural significance, and the Jokhang Temple, one of Tibet’s holiest shrines. Stroll through the vibrant Barkhor Street, and visit Sera and Trupeng Monasteries to immerse yourself in Tibetan culture. Enjoy the beauty of Yamdrok Lake and the majestic mountains on your return flight, creating unforgettable memories in this holy city. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Kathmandu – Lhasa Day 2: Lhasa Sightseeing Day 3: Lhasa Sightseeing and city tour Day 4: Lhasa- Kathmandu

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Kathmandu – Lhasa
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Depart from Katmandu by air to Lhasa . Arrival at Gonggar Airport . Transfer to a hotel in Lhasa (2hrs). Time at leisure. Overnight Lhasa

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Lhasa Sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Full day city tour of The Potala Palace, The Jokhang Temple, and Barkhor Street
The Potala Palace : Perched upon the Marpo Ri Hill, 130 meters above the Lhasa valley, it is the greatest monumental structure in Tibet .
The Jokhang Temple : The Jokhang is the most celebrated temple in Tibet . Because the temple is not controlled by a particular sect of Tibetan Buddhism it attracts adherents of all the sects as well as followers of Bon-Po , Tibet ‘s indigenous religion

Barkhor Street : The Barkhor is the oldest street in Lhasa as well as the center of old Lhasa and remains very traditional. It is a place where Tibetan culture, economy, religion and arts are assembled.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Lhasa Sightseeing and city tour
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Full day city tour of Sera Monastery, Trupeng Monastery, Norbulingka, and visit The Carpet Factory.

Sera Monastery It is known as one of the three greatest monasteries of Tibet .
Drupeng Monastery : It is one of the biggest monasteries in Tibet .
Norbulingka : Norbulingka means ” Jeweled Garden “. It was constructed as a summer palace for the Dalai Lama and later served the whole governmental administration.
The Carpet Factory : The highland of Tibet is the actual home of the oriental carpets. By visiting Carpet Factory you will have a general idea how carpets are produced

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Lhasa- Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            In the morning after breakfast, transfer to airport 02 hrs. Drive-Representative will assist you. Flight Lhasa/Kathmandu lasts for an hour. During the flight you will see the various beauties likeYarlung Tsangpo River , Lake Yamdrok , Mt. Kanchenjunga (8586m) and Mt. Makalu (8463m) and Mt.Everest (8848m). It too depends upon the weather.

title: Sri-Lanka Tour - 4N/5D
description: Enjoy a 4-night, 5-day trip from Kathmandu to Sri Lanka, starting in Colombo with visits to Galle Face Green and Gangaramaya Temple. Head to Kandy to explore the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic and enjoy a cultural dance performance. Then, visit Nuwara Eliya for its scenic tea plantations before relaxing in Bentota, a beautiful coastal town. Wrap up your journey with leisure time at the beach before flying back to Kathmandu. This itinerary blends cultural experiences with stunning natural beauty for an unforgettable getaway. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Arrival in Colombo Day 2: Colombo to Kandy Day 3: Kandy to Nuwara Eliya Day 4: Nuwara Eliya to Bentota Day 5: Bentota to Colombo & Departure

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Colombo
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Start your adventure by departing from Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu and flying to Bandaranaike International Airport in Colombo. Upon arrival, transfer to your hotel and spend the afternoon exploring Colombo’s vibrant sights. Visit notable landmarks such as Galle Face Green, Gangaramaya Temple, and Independence Memorial Hall. Don’t forget to check out Pettah Market for some local shopping. In the evening, enjoy a delicious dinner at a local Sri Lankan restaurant before relaxing at your hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Colombo to Kandy
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After a hearty breakfast at the hotel, embark on a scenic drive to Kandy, which takes about 3.5 hours. En route, visit the Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage, where you can see elephants up close. Upon arriving in Kandy, check in to your hotel and head to the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic, a UNESCO World Heritage site. In the evening, immerse yourself in Sri Lankan culture by watching a traditional dance performance. Enjoy dinner at a local restaurant and unwind at your hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Kandy to Nuwara Eliya
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            On Day 3, after breakfast, travel to Nuwara Eliya, known as "Little England," which is approximately a 2.5-hour drive. Stop by a tea plantation and factory along the way to learn about Sri Lanka’s famous Ceylon tea production. After checking in at your hotel in Nuwara Eliya, explore Gregory Lake and Victoria Park, both celebrated for their picturesque landscapes. Spend the evening relaxing and enjoying the colonial charm of the town, followed by dinner at your hotel or a nearby restaurant.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Nuwara Eliya to Bentota
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            On the fourth day, enjoy breakfast before departing for Bentota, a stunning coastal town famous for its beaches and water sports (approximately 5 hours away). Take in the scenic views and perhaps stop to admire waterfalls along the route. Upon arrival in Bentota, check in to your beachfront resort and spend the afternoon relaxing on the beach. In the evening, consider a sunset cruise on the Bentota River or enjoy dinner at a seaside restaurant.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Bentota to Colombo & Departure
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            On your final day, savor a leisurely breakfast and enjoy some free time at the beach. If time allows, visit a turtle hatchery before starting your journey back to Colombo, which takes around 2 hours. After reaching Colombo, transfer to Bandaranaike International Airport for your flight back to Kathmandu, bringing your memorable Sri Lanka trip to a close.
