duration:
Typical round-trip flights
last 1.5 to 2 hours, with 20–30 minutes over Everest and nearby peaks.
description: Everest From Plane tours are a unique way to witness the world’s highest peaks without the physical demands of trekking. Flying over the majestic Himalayas offers travelers an unforgettable perspective of Mount Everest, Lhotse, Nuptse, and surrounding mountains, all from the comfort of a plane.This guide covers why you should take an Everest flight, what to expect during the journey, travel tips, and how Guru Travels Limited can make your Everest aerial adventure seamless and memorable.Why Experience Everest From Plane?Seeing Mount Everest from a plane is an experience that combines convenience, safety, and stunning scenery:Panoramic Views: Get a bird’s-eye view of Everest and the surrounding Himalayan giants, including Lhotse, Ama Dablam, and Nuptse.Time-Saving: Ideal for travelers with limited time who still want a glimpse of Everest’s grandeur.Accessible to All: No trekking or physical exertion required, making it perfect for families, seniors, and international tourists.Photography Opportunities: Capture breathtaking aerial shots of snow-capped peaks and deep valleys.Memorable Experience: Watching Everest rise above the clouds is an awe-inspiring adventure you’ll never forget.How to Book an Everest From Plane TourDeparture Location: Most Everest flights depart from Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu.Duration: Typical round-trip flights last 1.5 to 2 hours, with 20–30 minutes over Everest and nearby peaks.Booking: Guru Travels Limited handles all flight bookings, airport transfers, permits, and ensures you get the best aerial experience.What to Expect on the Everest Flight.Flight Path: Flights usually head east from Kathmandu, crossing the scenic hills and valleys before reaching the Everest region.Views: Passengers are treated to uninterrupted views of iconic mountains, glaciersSeating Tips: Window seats on both sides are recommended; pilots often circle peaks to ensure everyone gets a view.Photography: Use a camera with a polarizing filter to reduce glare, and be ready for quick snapshots of the peaks.When you book with Guru Travels Ltd., we ensure you get a window seat for the best mountain views. If not, we’ll refund your full amount.”Why Book With Guru Travels LimitedGuru Travels Limited offers a hassle-free Everest From Plane experience:Expert Guidance: Professional assistance for booking and airport transfers.Safe and Reliable Flights: Partnered with certified airlines for secure operations.Flexible Packages: Combine Everest flights with Kathmandu city tours, cultural experiences, or other Himalayan excursions.Personalized Service: Tailored schedules and optional photography tips from experts.Take flight over the Himalayas and witness the glory of Everest in comfort and style with Guru Travels Limited.You May Also Like Everest Base Camp Hiking 11N / 12Days: Experience the iconic trek to Everest Base Camp, explore Sherpa villages,and enjoy stunning Himalayan scenery over a 12-day adventure.Everest Heli Tour – 4N/5D offers a once-in-a-lifetime adventure, flying close to Mount Everest and surrounding peaks, with cultural insights in Sherpa villages and comfort throughout your stay.” Outline Itinerary Day 1: Everest by Plane

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Everest by Plane
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Early in the morning, you will be picked up from your hotel and transferred to Tribhuvan International Airport (Domestic Terminal). After check-in, board a one-hour mountain flight that takes you close to the majestic Himalayas. During the journey, you’ll witness stunning panoramic views of Mount Everest (8,848 m) along with other famous peaks such as Lhotse, Makalu, Cho Oyu, and Gaurishankar. Each passenger gets a window seat, and the crew will point out the mountains as you fly past.

title: Full day Kathmandu Sightseeing- 1 Day
description: Kathmandu Tour is a journey through Nepal’s vibrant capital city, where history, culture, and modern life intersect. From centuries-old temples and palaces to bustling markets and lively streets, Kathmandu provides a unique blend of tradition and contemporary experiences.Whether you are a first-time visitor or returning to explore deeper, a Kathmandu Tour offers an unforgettable experience. This guide covers the best attractions, historical sites, cultural highlights, travel tips, and optional excursions such as Chandragiri Hill and Champa Devi Hike, along with how Guru Travels Limited can make your Kathmandu adventure seamless and memorable.Why Take a Kathmandu Tour?Kathmandu, the heart of Nepal, is a city filled with rich history and culture. Here’s why you should take a Kathmandu Tour:Historic Landmarks: Explore iconic sites like Durbar Square, Swayambhunath Stupa, and Pashupatinath Temple, each reflecting centuries of history and art.Cultural Experience: Experience the diverse traditions of the Newar, Tamang, and other local communities through festivals, architecture, and daily life.Vibrant Markets: Thamel, Asan, and New Road are hubs for local crafts, souvenirs, spices, and Nepali street food.Gastronomic Adventure: Taste authentic Nepali cuisine, including momo, dal bhat, and local sweets.Scenic Excursions: Kathmandu also offers easy access to hills and short hikes like Chandragiri Hill and Champa Devi, perfect for panoramic views and nature walks.How to Explore KathmanduA well-planned Kathmandu Tour ensures you experience the city efficiently:Private Guided Tours: Guru Travels Limited provides professional guides who can take you through major sites, hidden gems, and cultural experiences.Walking Tours: Many areas, like Thamel and Durbar Square, are best explored on foot to soak in the atmosphere.Vehicle Transfers: For longer distances, comfortable car or van services ensure a hassle-free experience.Day Trips & Excursions: Include visits to nearby cities like Bhaktapur, Patan, and short hikes such as Chandragiri Hill and Champa Devi Hike.Guru Travels Limited manages all logistics, from airport pickup to guided city tours, making your Kathmandu Tour smooth and enjoyable.Top Attractions on a Kathmandu TourDurbar Square A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Kathmandu Durbar Square is home to palaces, courtyards, and temples that showcase exquisite Newar architecture. Highlights include the Hanuman Dhoka Palace and Kumari Ghar.Swayambhunath Stupa (Monkey Temple) Perched on a hill, this ancient stupa offers panoramic views of the city. Pilgrims and tourists alike come to spin prayer wheels, admire intricate carvings, and witness the harmonious blend of Buddhism and Hinduism.Pashupatinath Temple One of the most sacred Hindu temples, Pashupatinath Temple is a must-visit for its architecture, spiritual significance, and riverside cremation ghats along the Bagmati River.Boudhanath Stupa A major center for Tibetan Buddhism, Boudhanath Stupa is surrounded by monasteries and lively markets. Visitors can observe traditional rituals, spinning prayer wheels, and colorful prayer flags.Garden of Dreams A serene oasis in the heart of Kathmandu, the Garden of Dreams is perfect for relaxation and photography. Its fountains, classical architecture, and landscaped gardens provide a peaceful escape from the bustling city.Chandragiri Hill Located about 16 km southwest of Kathmandu, Chandragiri Hill offers a cable car ride to panoramic views of the Kathmandu Valley and Himalayan range. It’s an ideal short excursion for families and travelers looking for scenic vistas and a nature-filled retreat.Champa Devi Hike For trekking enthusiasts, the Champa Devi Hike is a rewarding half-day trail near the valley. This moderate hike leads to the Champa Devi temple, offering breathtaking views of the Kathmandu Valley and surrounding hills. It’s a perfect blend of adventure, nature, and spirituality.Culture and Local ExperiencesExperiencing Kathmandu goes beyond sightseeing. Here’s how to immerse yourself in local culture:Festivals: Witness vibrant celebrations like Dashain, Tihar, and Indra Jatra, reflecting the city’s spiritual and cultural diversity.Local Cuisine: Enjoy street food, cafes, and traditional Nepali meals in Thamel, Patan, or Boudha.Art & Handicrafts: Visit markets for handmade pottery, thangka paintings, and traditional jewelry.Homestays & Guesthouses: Interact with locals to learn about their customs, lifestyle, and culinary traditions.Short Hikes & Temples: Visiting Chandragiri Hill and Champa Devi allows travelers to combine culture, spiritual experiences, and scenic trekking.Why Book with Guru Travels LimitedA Kathmandu Tour can be hectic without proper planning. Guru Travels Limited ensures your visit is organized, safe, and immersive:Customized Itineraries: Tailored to your interests, duration, and budget.Expert Guides: Knowledgeable about history, culture, and hidden gems.Comfortable Transport: Private cars, airport transfers, and short-excursion transport included.Cultural Immersion: Experience authentic local life while respecting traditions.Excursion Assistance: Easy planning and bookings for Chandragiri Hill and Champa Devi Hike. Plan your Kathmandu Tour today with Guru Travels Limited and explore the heart of Nepal in comfort, adventure, and style. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Kathmandu Valley Sightseeing

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Kathmandu Valley Sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Your tour begins with a warm welcome from your guide at your hotel, who will escort you to the Bouddhanath Stupa, one of the holiest sites for both Buddhists and Hindus. As you explore the vast stupa, you'll be surrounded by the hum of prayer wheels and the sight of pilgrims making their offerings. The iconic Buddha eyes watching over the square create a serene atmosphere. Next, you'll visit Pashupatinath Temple, an important Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Located along the Bagmati River, it’s a powerful spiritual site where you can observe daily rituals and the sacred cremation ghats. Finally, your tour will take you to Bhaktapur Durbar Square, a UNESCO World Heritage Site filled with magnificent pagoda-style temples, the ornate 55-Window Palace, and vibrant market streets. Here, you’ll get a glimpse into the rich history and culture of Nepal, with beautiful architecture and bustling local life.

excerpt: Kathmandu Tour is a journey through Nepal’s vibrant capital city, where history, culture, and modern life intersect. From centuries-old temples and pa...

title: Pokhara and Sarangkot Tour 2N/3D
description: Pokhara & Sarangkot Tour from Kathmandu: A Journey to Nepal’s SerenityWhen it comes to travel in Nepal, Pokhara and Sarangkot remain timeless favorites for both domestic and international travelers. Just a short journey from Kathmandu, this trip blends nature, culture, and adventure in the most delightful way. If you’re planning a quick getaway, a Pokhara & Sarangkot tour from Kathmandu promises you breathtaking mountains, peaceful lakes, and a sunrise experience that will stay in your memory forever.Himalayan Views to CherishOne of the biggest highlights of this trip is the unparalleled mountain panorama you can witness from Pokhara and Sarangkot. On clear days, the sky opens up to reveal some of Nepal’s most iconic peaks:Annapurna Massif (8,091 m) – The 10th highest mountain in the world, forming a stunning backdrop to Pokhara Valley.Machhapuchhre (Fishtail Mountain, 6,993 m) – Sacred and unclimbed, its unique fishtail shape dominates the skyline.Dhaulagiri (8,167 m) – The 7th highest peak in the world, often glowing golden during sunrise.Himalchuli (7,893 m) – A majestic peak of the Mansiri Himal range.Manaslu (8,163 m) – The world’s 8th highest peak, visible in the distance on crystal-clear mornings.Lamjung Himal (6,983 m) – Adding grace to the eastern panorama.From Sarangkot sunrise point, you’ll see these snowcapped peaks bathed in hues of pink, orange, and gold, creating a once-in-a-lifetime spectacle.Why Visit Pokhara & Sarangkot?✨ Pokhara – The City of LakesKnown as the gateway to the Annapurna region, Pokhara is a serene escape where you can enjoy boating in Phewa Lake, stroll around the bustling Lakeside area, and explore natural wonders like Davis Falls and Gupteshwor Mahadev Cave. The laid-back vibe of Pokhara is the perfect contrast to Kathmandu’s busy streets.✨ Sarangkot – Sunrise with the HimalayasJust 30 minutes from Pokhara, Sarangkot is a hilltop village famous for its spectacular sunrise view and adventure activities like paragliding. Kathmandu to Pokhara Travel Options🚗 By Road (6–7 hours): Scenic drive along the Prithvi Highway.✈️ By Flight (25 minutes): Quick aerial views of the Himalayas. Highlights of the Pokhara & Sarangkot TourBoating on Phewa Lake with reflections of Machhapuchhre.Exploring Bindhyabasini Temple, International Mountain Museum, and natural caves.Sunrise view from Sarangkot.Adventure activities: paragliding, zip-lining, cycling.Relaxing evenings at Lakeside Pokhara with cafés and live music. Ideal Duration2 Nights / 3 Days package from Kathmandu is perfect to enjoy Pokhara and Sarangkot at a relaxed pace. Best Time to VisitAutumn (Sept–Nov): Clear skies, pleasant weather.Spring (Mar–May): Blooming rhododendrons.Winter (Dec–Feb): Cold mornings, crystal-clear mountain views. The Pokhara & Sarangkot tour from Kathmandu is more than a trip—it’s a soulful experience. From sunrise over the Himalayas to evenings by the lake, it’s a journey you’ll always cherish.👉 Ready to experience Pokhara & Sarangkot? Book your package with Guru Travels Ltd and let us craft a seamless journey for you. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Arrive in the beautiful city of Pokhara Day 2: Drive to Sarangkot Day 3: Boating experience and Return to Kathmandu

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrive in the beautiful city of Pokhara
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            arrive in the beautiful city of Pokhara after a scenic drive or short flight from Kathmandu. After hotel check-in, spend your afternoon exploring the calm surroundings of Phewa Lake with a relaxing boat ride to Tal Barahi Temple, followed by a visit to Davis Falls and the mystical Gupteshwor Cave. In the evening, enjoy a peaceful stroll along Lakeside, filled with lively cafés, shops, and a vibrant atmosphere.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Drive to Sarangkot
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Wake up early for a drive or cable car ride to Sarangkot, where you’ll witness a breathtaking sunrise over the snow-capped peaks of Annapurna, Dhaulagiri, and Machhapuchhre. After returning for breakfast, continue with a half-day sightseeing tour covering the Bindhyabasini Temple, the International Mountain Museum, and the serene World Peace Pagoda, offering panoramic views of the valley. Adventure lovers can also add paragliding or zip-lining from Sarangkot for an extra thrill.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Boating experience and Return to Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Enjoy a leisurely breakfast and perhaps a final walk or boating experience at Phewa Lake before bidding farewell to Pokhara. You will then depart for Kathmandu or your onward destination, carrying with you unforgettable memories of Pokhara’s natural beauty and Sarangkot’s magical sunrise.

title: Chitwan National Park 2N/3D
description: Chitwan National Park Tour from Kathmandu: A Wildlife Adventure in NepalEscape the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu and step into the wild with the Chitwan National Park 2N/3D tour. Known for its rich biodiversity and thrilling safari experiences, Chitwan is a paradise for wildlife enthusiasts and nature lovers alike. From spotting one-horned rhinoceroses to enjoying serene canoe rides along the Rapti River, this tour offers a perfect mix of adventure, relaxation, and cultural experiences. Why Should You Visit Chitwan National Park?Unique Wildlife Encounters: Spot endangered species like one-horned rhinos, Bengal tigers, and gharials in their natural habitat.Rich Birdlife: Over 500 species of birds make it a birdwatcher’s haven.Cultural Immersion: Experience the vibrant traditions and lifestyle of the Tharu community.Adventure & Nature: From jeep and elephant safaris to canoe rides and jungle walks, there’s something for every nature enthusiast.Accessible from Kathmandu: Just a 5–6 hour drive away, making it perfect for a short getaway. Major Highlights & AttractionsWildlife Safari – Jeep and elephant safaris to spot one-horned rhinos, Bengal tigers, deer, and exotic birds.Canoe Ride – A peaceful exploration of Chitwan’s rivers while observing aquatic birds and crocodiles.Tharu Cultural Experience – Discover the traditional lifestyle, dance, and music of the indigenous Tharu community.Bird Watching – Chitwan is home to over 500 bird species, making it a paradise for bird lovers.Nature Walks & Jungle Trails – Guided walks through the park’s forests, grasslands, and wetlands.Kathmandu to Chitwan: Travel Options & Duration🚗 By Road (5–6 hours): Comfortable tourist bus or private vehicle along the scenic highway.🚌 By Tourist Bus: Economical and convenient for group travelers. Best Time to VisitAutumn (Sept–Nov): Pleasant weather and best for wildlife spotting.Winter (Dec–Feb): Cool mornings, easy outdoor activities.Spring (Mar–May): Lush landscapes, ideal for bird watching. The Chitwan National Park tour from Kathmandu is a wildlife adventure you’ll never forget. Whether you’re looking for thrilling safaris, serene nature walks, or cultural immersion, Chitwan delivers an unforgettable experience. 👉 Ready to explore Chitwan National Park? Book your 2N/3D package with Guru Travels Ltd and create memories of Nepal’s wilderness. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Kathmandu to Chitwan Day 2: Full-Day Jungle Activities Day 3: Chitwan ➝ Kathmandu

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Kathmandu to  Chitwan
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Morning drive/fly from Kathmandu to Chitwan. On arrival, welcome drink and check-in. After lunch, relax at the resort. Late afternoon, stroll to the riverside for sunset views. In the evening, enjoy Tharu Cultural Dance with folk music and storytelling. Dinner & overnight at the resort.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Full-Day Jungle Activities
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Early breakfast, then head for Jeep Safari inside the national park to spot one-horned rhino, deer, wild boar, monkeys, and if lucky, the elusive Bengal tiger. Later, a peaceful canoe ride along the Rapti/Riu rivers to see crocodiles and water birds, followed by a short guided jungle walk and birdwatching. Visit the Elephant Breeding Center (observational/educational). Return to resort, free time, dinner & overnight.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Chitwan ➝ Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Wake up to birdsong; optional short village walk. Breakfast, check-out, and drive/fly back to Kathmandu with wonderful memories.

title: Annapurna Base Camp Trek (7N/8D)
description: The Annapurna Base Camp (ABC) Trek is one of Nepal’s most iconic adventures, combining stunning Himalayan scenery, cultural richness, and rewarding trekking trails. Over 7 nights and 8 days, this journey takes you through lush forests, charming Gurung and Magar villages, and right into the heart of the Annapurna Sanctuary.Why Should You Visit?Panoramic Himalayan Views: Stand face-to-face with Annapurna I (8,091m), Machhapuchhre (Fishtail, 6,993m), Hiunchuli (6,441m), Annapurna South (7,219m), and more.Diverse Landscapes: From terraced farmlands to alpine meadows and glacial valleys. Cultural Experience: Explore Gurung and Magar villages like Ghandruk and Chhomrong.Moderate Adventure: Perfect balance of challenge and accessibility for beginner and experienced trekkers.Bucket-List Trek: Step into the legendary Annapurna Sanctuary at 4,130m.Major Highlights & Mountain ViewsPokhara & Ghandruk: First glimpses of Annapurna South, Hiunchuli, and Machhapuchhre.Chhomrong: Close views of Machhapuchhre and Annapurna South.Bamboo & Deurali: Forest walks with sneak peeks of snow peaks through the valleys.Machhapuchhre Base Camp (MBC): Breathtaking close-up of Fishtail, Annapurna III, Gandharva Chuli.Annapurna Base Camp (ABC): 360° panorama of Annapurna I, Annapurna South, Hiunchuli, Machhapuchhre, Tent Peak, and Gangapurna.Travel Options & DurationKathmandu → Pokhara: 6–7 hrs by tourist bus/private vehicle, or 25-min flight.Pokhara → Nayapul (Trek Start Point): 1.5 hr drive.Trek Duration: 7N/8D (walking 5–7 hrs daily, moderate difficulty).Best Time to VisitSpring (Mar–May): Rhododendrons in bloom, clear mountain views.Autumn (Sep–Nov): Best weather, crystal-clear skies.Winter (Dec–Feb): Snowy trails, fewer trekkers, colder nights.Summer (Jun–Aug): Monsoon season, lush greenery but limited visibility. The Annapurna Base Camp Trek is more than just a trek—it’s a life-changing journey into the heart of the Himalayas. Each stop along the way offers new perspectives of the mountains, from the first glimpse of Machhapuchhre in Pokhara to the awe-inspiring 360° panorama at ABC itself. This adventure is perfect for both first-time trekkers and seasoned explorers, offering a balance of challenge, natural beauty, and cultural experiences. Book your Annapurna Base Camp Trek with Guru Travels Ltd today and immerse yourself in one of the world’s most breathtaking trekking experiences. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Kathmandu to Pokhara (820m | 6–7 hrs drive / 25 min flight) Day 2: Pokhara to Ghandruk via Nayapul (1,940m | 1.5 hr drive + 5–6 hrs trek) Day 3: Ghandruk to Chhomrong (2,170m | 5–6 hrs trek) Day 4: Chhomrong to Bamboo (2,310m | 5–6 hrs trek) Day 5: Bamboo to Deurali (3,230m | 5–6 hrs trek) Day 6: Deurali to Annapurna Base Camp via Machhapuchhre Base Camp (4,130m | 6–7 hrs trek) Day 7: Annapurna Base Camp to Bamboo (2,310m | 6–7 hrs trek) Day 8: Bamboo to Pokhara via Chhomrong & Nayapul (6–7 hrs trek + 1.5 hr drive)

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Kathmandu to Pokhara (820m | 6–7 hrs drive / 25 min flight)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Your journey begins with a scenic drive or a short flight from Kathmandu to Pokhara. If you choose to drive, the route takes you along winding roads with views of hills, rivers, and countryside settlements, while the flight offers breathtaking glimpses of the Himalayan range in just 25 minutes. Upon reaching Pokhara, you’ll settle into your hotel and have the evening free to explore Lakeside, where the calm waters of Phewa Lake beautifully reflect Machhapuchhre (Fishtail) and Annapurna South. Overnight stay at Pokhara.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Pokhara to Ghandruk via Nayapul (1,940m | 1.5 hr drive + 5–6 hrs trek)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, a short drive takes you to Nayapul, the starting point of your trek. From here, you begin your journey on foot, passing terraced fields, rivers, and charming villages. The trail gradually ascends as you make your way to the traditional Gurung village of Ghandruk, famous for its rich culture and warm hospitality. Along the way and especially from the village itself, you’ll be rewarded with stunning views of Annapurna South, Hiunchuli, and Machhapuchhre (Fishtail). Overnight in Ghandruk.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Ghandruk to Chhomrong (2,170m | 5–6 hrs trek)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today’s trek begins with a descent through stone-paved paths towards Kimrong Khola, followed by a steady climb uphill through lush forests of oak and rhododendron. The trail then levels out as you reach Chhomrong, a large Gurung settlement nestled on the lap of the Annapurna range. From here, you’ll have majestic, close-up views of Annapurna South and Machhapuchhre, making Chhomrong one of the most scenic villages along the route. Overnight in Chhomrong.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Chhomrong to Bamboo (2,310m | 5–6 hrs trek)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            From Chhomrong, you descend a series of stone steps to the Chhomrong Khola and cross a suspension bridge. The trail then climbs steadily through thick forests of bamboo, oak, and rhododendron until you reach a small settlement aptly named Bamboo. The air here is cooler and fresher, with the forest canopy surrounding you, offering a peaceful trekking experience. Overnight in Bamboo.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Bamboo to Deurali (3,230m | 5–6 hrs trek)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The trail today passes through dense forests, gradually opening up to reveal the rugged landscapes of the Annapurna region. You’ll climb past Dovan and Himalaya villages, with waterfalls cascading along the trail. As you approach Deurali, the vegetation begins to thin, and the valley widens with dramatic cliffs on both sides. From this point, you start to see glimpses of Machhapuchhre and Hiunchuli peeking through the ridges. Overnight in Deurali.

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Deurali to Annapurna Base Camp via Machhapuchhre Base Camp (4,130m | 6–7 hrs trek)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            This is one of the most rewarding days of the trek. From Deurali, you ascend steadily along the valley to reach Machhapuchhre Base Camp (3,700m), where the sight of Machhapuchhre (Fishtail) towering above will leave you in awe. The trail continues to rise until you reach Annapurna Base Camp (4,130m), surrounded by a natural amphitheater of towering peaks including Annapurna I, Annapurna South, Hiunchuli, Machhapuchhre, and Tent Peak. The 360° panorama from ABC is simply breathtaking and one of the most iconic views in the Himalayas. Overnight at Annapurna Base Camp.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Annapurna Base Camp to Bamboo (2,310m | 6–7 hrs trek)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Wake up early to witness the sunrise over the Annapurna range—a moment that will stay with you forever. The morning sun lights up Annapurna I, Machhapuchhre, Hiunchuli, and South Annapurna in golden hues. After enjoying this unforgettable spectacle, you retrace your steps down the valley, descending past Machhapuchhre Base Camp, Deurali, and Himalaya before reaching Bamboo. Overnight in Bamboo.

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: Bamboo to Pokhara via Chhomrong & Nayapul (6–7 hrs trek + 1.5 hr drive)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Your final trekking day begins with a gradual descent through forests and stone steps back to Chhomrong, where you’ll once again be greeted with views of Annapurna South and Machhapuchhre. After descending to Nayapul, you’ll take a short drive back to Pokhara. The trek officially ends here, and you can celebrate your achievement with some leisure time in Pokhara, strolling by Phewa Lake or enjoying the vibrant Lakeside atmosphere. Overnight in Pokhara.

title: Ghorepani Poon Hill Trek 4N/ 5D
description: IntroductionThe Ghorepani Poon Hill Trek is the ultimate short Himalayan journey for those who wish to experience breathtaking mountain views, charming Gurung villages, and the magic of sunrise over the Annapurna Range. This 4-night/5-day adventure takes you through lush rhododendron forests, terraced hillsides, and traditional settlements, offering a perfect blend of culture, nature, and adventure.Unlike strenuous long treks, Poon Hill is ideal for beginners and families while still delivering world-class Himalayan panoramas. Every step along the trail brings you closer to the snow-capped peaks, making it one of the most rewarding short treks in Nepal. Why Should You Visit?Mesmerizing Sunrise: Witness one of the world’s most stunning sunrises over Annapurna, Dhaulagiri & Machhapuchhre (Fishtail).Cultural Experience: Stay in cozy teahouses, interact with Gurung & Magar communities, and enjoy warm Nepali hospitality.Accessible Trek: Short and easy, perfect for first-time trekkers or those with limited time.Natural Beauty: Dense rhododendron forests, waterfalls, and scenic hill landscapes.Adventure & Comfort: A balanced trek with moderate trails, rewarding views, and comfortable accommodations. Major Highlights & AttractionsPanoramic views of Annapurna I, Annapurna South, Dhaulagiri, Machhapuchhre (Fishtail), Hiunchuli, and Nilgiri.Poon Hill Viewpoint (3,210m): One of Nepal’s most famous sunrise spots.Traditional Villages: Ghorepani, Ulleri, and Ghandruk – rich in Gurung & Magar culture.Rhododendron Forests: Especially spectacular in spring (Mar–Apr).Short yet Rewarding: Covers the best of the Annapurna region in just 5 days. Travel Options & DurationKathmandu to Pokhara: 6–7 hours by road or 25-minute flight.Pokhara to Nayapul (Trek Start Point): 1.5-hour drive.Trek Duration: 4 Nights / 5 Days (Moderate walking, 4–6 hours daily).Best Time to VisitAutumn (Sep–Nov): Best visibility, crystal-clear mountain views.Spring (Mar–May): Rhododendron forests in full bloom.Winter (Dec–Feb): Fewer crowds, crisp skies (chilly mornings).Summer (Jun–Aug): Rainy but lush & green, off-season discounts. The Ghorepani Poon Hill Trek is a short yet incredibly rewarding Himalayan journey that lets you experience Nepal’s natural beauty, cultural richness, and stunning mountain landscapes in just five days. With its easy accessibility, moderate trails, and world-class sunrise views, it’s the perfect trek for beginners, families, and adventure lovers alike.Every step takes you closer to the mighty Annapurna & Dhaulagiri ranges while immersing you in the warmth of Nepali villages and teahouse hospitality. By the time you return, you’ll carry memories of golden Himalayan sunrises and heartwarming cultural encounters.👉 Book your Ghorepani Poon Hill Trek with Guru Travels Ltd today and experience the Himalayas in the most unforgettable way! Outline Itinerary Day 1: kathmandu to pokhara Day 2: pokhara to ghorepani vai ulleri Day 3: morning poon hill sunrise, trek to ghandruk Day 4: ghandruk to pokhara

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: kathmandu to pokhara
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Begin your journey with a scenic drive (or flight) from Kathmandu to Pokhara, Nepal’s picturesque lake city. Along the way, enjoy views of rivers, terraced fields, and rolling hills. Upon arrival in Pokhara, you can explore the lakeside area with stunning Himalayan backdrops.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: pokhara to ghorepani vai ulleri
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, drive to Nayapul and start your trek. Passing through lush forests, small villages, and stone steps at Ulleri, the trail gradually ascends towards Ghorepani. The day offers beautiful landscapes and glimpses of local Gurung and Magar culture. Overnight stay at Ghorepani with magnificent mountain views.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: morning poon hill sunrise, trek to ghandruk
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Early morning hike to Poon Hill (3,210m) for a breathtaking sunrise over Annapurna and Dhaulagiri ranges. After capturing the magical panorama, trek down to Ghorepani for breakfast and continue your journey through rhododendron forests and traditional villages before reaching the charming Gurung village of Ghandruk. Overnight at Ghandruk with close-up views of Annapurna South, Hiunchuli, and Machhapuchhre (Fishtail).

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: ghandruk to pokhara
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Wake up to serene mountain views, explore Ghandruk’s traditional Gurung culture, and then descend towards Nayapul. From there, drive back to Pokhara, where the trek concludes. Spend the evening relaxing by Phewa Lake or exploring the vibrant lakeside.

title: Kenya Safari 7 Nights 8 Days
description: Dreaming of the ultimate African wildlife adventure? Our Kenya Safari 7 Nights 8 Days package is crafted to immerse you in the heart of East Africa’s most iconic destinations. From the flamingo-filled Lake Nakuru to the legendary Maasai Mara, the serene waters of Lake Naivasha, and the vibrant city of Nairobi, this journey combines thrilling game drives, breathtaking landscapes, and authentic cultural encounters. Starting from Kathmandu to Nairobi, this safari is ideal for families, couples, adventure lovers, and wildlife enthusiasts seeking a once-in-a-lifetime holiday. Why Choose the Kenya Safari 7N/8D? Spot Africa’s Big Five (lion, elephant, leopard, rhino, buffalo) in their natural habitats.Explore the vast savannahs of the Maasai Mara, one of the world’s greatest safari reserves.Visit Lake Nakuru National Park, home to rhinos and thousands of flamingos.Enjoy a boat ride on Lake Naivasha and a guided walking safari on Crescent Island.Discover Nairobi National Park, where wildlife roams just outside the city.Immerse yourself in Kenyan culture and traditions with a guided city tour. What’s IncludedRound-trip international flights (Kathmandu – Nairobi – Kathmandu)Accommodation in handpicked lodges and safari campsDaily meals as per itinerary4x4 safari vehicle with professional guidesAll national park entrance feesDomestic transfers & airport pick-ups/drop-offs Guided cultural experience in Nairobi Ideal For Adventure seekers chasing a true African safariFamilies wanting wildlife, comfort & safety combinedCouples dreaming of a romantic escape under African skiesCultural travelers exploring authentic Kenyan heritage Visa & Entry Requirements (For Nepali Citizens) Kenya requires an Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA) instead of a visa. Application: Apply online up to 90 days before departure Processing time: 3 days (approx.) Fee: USD 32.50 (single-entry) Validity: 90 days (stay up to 90 consecutive days) Required Documents:Valid passport (minimum 6 months)Passport-size photoProof of accommodation / invitation letterYellow fever vaccination certificateReturn / onward flight ticket 👉 Planning to visit Kenya, Uganda, and Rwanda? Get the East Africa Tourist Visa (USD 100) for multiple entries within 90 days. ✅ With Guru Travels Limited, all visa/eTA arrangements are handled for you—making your journey hassle-free. Accommodationsuru Travels Limited, we ensure your safari stay is as memorable as the adventure:Nairobi Hotels – Modern city comfortLake Nakuru, Maasai Mara & Naivasha Lodges – Cozy stays close to nature, some overlooking the savannahUpgrade Options: Luxury tented camps, boutique lodges, or private villas Customization Options Personalize your Kenya Safari 7N/8D itinerary with:Hot air balloon safari over the Maasai MaraExtra safari days in Amboseli or Tsavo National ParksLuxury tent upgrades or private guidesPost-safari beach holidays in Mombasa or Zanzibar 📞 Contact Guru Travels Limited Let Guru Travels Limited, Nepal’s first public travel company, plan your dream Kenya Safari 7 Nights / 8 Days. 📱 +977 9851334626 📧 Email | 🌍 Instagram | 📘 Facebook | 🎵 TikTok We are committed to providing professional service, personalized assistance, and exclusive offers. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Arrival in Nairobi from Kathmandu Day 2: Nairobi – Lake Nakuru National Park Day 3: Lake Nakuru – Maasai Mara Game Reserve Day 4: Full-Day Maasai Mara Safari Experience Day 5: Maasai Mara – Lake Naivasha Day 6: Lake Naivasha – Nairobi National Park Day 7: Nairobi Cultural Tour Day 8: Departure from Nairobi

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Nairobi from Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Your journey begins with an international flight from Kathmandu to Nairobi. On arrival at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, our representative will welcome you and transfer you to your hotel. Depending on arrival time, you may enjoy a short evening city orientation or relax at the hotel before your safari adventure begins. Overnight in Nairobi.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Nairobi – Lake Nakuru National Park
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, drive to Lake Nakuru National Park, famous for its pink-hued flamingos, pelicans, and rhinos. En route, enjoy scenic views of the Great Rift Valley. In the afternoon, embark on a game drive where you can spot white and black rhinos, giraffes, lions, and diverse birdlife. Overnight stay in a lodge inside or near the park, with dinner included.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Lake Nakuru – Maasai Mara Game Reserve
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Depart for the world-renowned Maasai Mara Game Reserve, a highlight of the Kenya Safari 7N/8D itinerary. Arrive in time for lunch, followed by an evening game drive. Spot herds of wildebeest, elephants, zebras, and predators roaming the vast grasslands. Overnight in a luxury safari camp or lodge in Maasai Mara.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Full-Day Maasai Mara Safari Experience
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Spend a full day exploring the Maasai Mara, home to Africa’s “Big Five.” Morning and afternoon game drives offer opportunities to spot lions on the hunt, elephants grazing, and cheetahs sprinting across the plains. During migration season (July–October), witness the spectacular Great Wildebeest Migration across the Mara River. A picnic lunch will be served in the wilderness. Optional activity: hot air balloon safari at sunrise for a bird’s-eye view of the savannah. Overnight in Maasai Mara.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Maasai Mara – Lake Naivasha
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, drive towards Lake Naivasha, a freshwater lake surrounded by lush greenery and wildlife. In the afternoon, enjoy a peaceful boat safari to see hippos, fish eagles, and exotic bird species. Optional guided walk on Crescent Island, where giraffes, zebras, and antelopes roam freely without predators. Overnight in a lakeside lodge.

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Lake Naivasha – Nairobi National Park
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Return to Nairobi and head straight to Nairobi National Park, one of the only national parks located next to a capital city. Here you’ll see lions, giraffes, zebras, and even rhinos against the backdrop of Nairobi’s skyline. Afternoon at leisure or optional visits to the Giraffe Centre or David Sheldrick Elephant Orphanage. Overnight stay in Nairobi.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Nairobi Cultural Tour
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Experience Kenya’s vibrant culture with a guided city tour. Visit the Bomas of Kenya for traditional dances and cultural performances, explore craft markets for souvenirs, and discover the history of Kenya at local museums. In the evening, enjoy a farewell dinner featuring authentic Kenyan cuisine with live cultural music. Overnight in Nairobi.

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: Departure from Nairobi
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, transfer to Jomo Kenyatta International Airport for your return flight to Kathmandu. Your Kenya Safari 7 Nights 8 Days adventure concludes with unforgettable memories of wildlife encounters, cultural discoveries, and breathtaking landscapes.

title: Thailand & Vietnam 8 Nights / 9 Days Tour Package
description: Tour Package OverviewDiscover the vibrant culture, scenic beauty, and diverse experiences of Thailand and Vietnam with our specially curated 8 Nights / 9 Days tour package for Nepali travelers. Begin your journey in Pattaya, Thailand’s lively beach city, with a full day Coral Island excursion. Explore Bangkok’s cultural treasures with a half day city tour before enjoying a free day for shopping or optional activities. Then, fly to Vietnam’s historic capital, Hanoi, and immerse yourself in its charm before embarking on a magical overnight cruise in Ha Long Bay, one of the world’s natural wonders. Complete your journey with a full day exploration of Hanoi’s cultural landmarks. Guru Travels Limited ensures a smooth, comfortable, and unforgettable travel experience with carefully planned activities, comfortable stays, and guided tours. This itinerary offers a perfect balance of relaxation, adventure, and cultural immersion for all types of travelers.Package Highlights Enjoy a full day Coral Island tour in Pattaya, including water sports and a delicious lunch. Experience Bangkok’s famous landmarks during a guided half day city tour. Spend a free day in Bangkok for shopping or exploring at your own pace. Fly to Hanoi and enjoy a scenic overnight cruise on Ha Long Bay by bus transfer. Visit limestone caves, floating villages, and scenic islands during your Ha Long Bay cruise. Explore Hanoi’s historic Old Quarter, museums, and temples on a full day city tour. Seamless transfers, comfortable hotels, and professional guides throughout the trip.What’s Included International and domestic flights (Bangkok to Hanoi) Accommodation with breakfast Airport transfers and transportation by private car Guided tours with entrance fees included English speaking tour guides in Thailand and Vietnam Ideal For Nepali Travelers Families looking for a mix of beach fun, cultural sightseeing, and scenic cruises. Couples seeking romantic city stays and an unforgettable cruise experience. Solo travelers who want to explore iconic cities and natural wonders. Groups interested in private or shared guided tours with a balanced itinerary.Duration Total: 8 Nights / 9 Days Pattaya: 2 Nights Bangkok: 2 Nights Hanoi: 2 Nights Ha Long Bay Cruise: 1 Night Hanoi (Final Stay): 1 NightVisa InformationNepali travelers require tourist visas for both Thailand and Vietnam. Guru Travels Limited assists with the complete visa application process, including guidance on required documents, embassy procedures, and processing timelines. We recommend starting the process early to ensure a smooth start to your trip. Our expert team ensures you are well prepared with all necessary documents and helps avoid unnecessary delays. We also provide important travel tips for a hassle-free arrival at both destinations.AccommodationsStay at handpicked hotels in prime locations in Pattaya, Bangkok, and Hanoi for easy access to attractions and transportation. Enjoy an unforgettable overnight stay aboard a comfortable Ha Long Bay cruise, with modern amenities and breathtaking views. All accommodations include breakfast and essential facilities such as air conditioning, WiFi, and friendly service. We partner with trusted hotels and cruise operators to ensure you have a safe, clean, and welcoming environment throughout your journey.Customization OptionsGuru Travels Limited offers flexible customization options so you can tailor the itinerary to your preferences. Extend your stay in Bangkok or Hanoi, upgrade to luxury resorts or premium cruises, or add special experiences such as spa treatments, water sports, or cultural shows. Whether you prefer a more relaxed pace or extra adventure, our team can design the perfect trip just for you. We can also arrange private transfers, exclusive tours, and special meal arrangements to make your holiday even more memorable.Contact Us Let Guru Travels Limited, Nepal’s first public travel company, plan your dream Thailand & Vietnam holiday today! Our experienced team is here to make your journey smooth, exciting, and unforgettable. Get in touch for customized packages, special offers, and expert travel advice. Outline Itinerary Day 1: Arrive at Don Mueang Airport (DMK) – Transfer to Pattaya Day 2: Pattaya Coral Island Tour with Lunch Day 3: Pattaya to Bangkok & Half Day City Tour Day 4: Free Day in Bangkok Day 5: Flight to Hanoi Day 6: Hanoi to Ha Long Bay – Overnight Cruise by Bus Day 7: Ha Long Bay to Hanoi by Bus Day 8: Hanoi FullDay City Tour Day 9: Departure from Hanoi

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrive at Don Mueang Airport (DMK) – Transfer to Pattaya
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Upon arrival at Bangkok’s Don Mueang Airport, you will be warmly welcomed by our representative. Transfer by private vehicle to Pattaya, a lively beach destination known for its entertainment, shopping, and water sports. After hotel check-in, you can rest from your journey or take an evening stroll along Pattaya Beach. Enjoy the vibrant nightlife or simply relax and prepare for the adventures ahead.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Pattaya Coral Island Tour with Lunch
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, set off on an exciting boat ride to Coral Island, also known as Koh Larn. The island is famous for its white sandy beaches, crystal clear waters, and opportunities for water sports like parasailing and jet skiing. Spend time swimming, relaxing under beach umbrellas, or exploring the island’s local shops. Enjoy a freshly prepared lunch before returning to Pattaya in the afternoon for leisure time.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Pattaya to Bangkok & Half Day City Tour
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Check out from your Pattaya hotel and transfer to Bangkok. On arrival, start a guided city tour covering Bangkok’s iconic landmarks such as the Grand Palace, Wat Pho, and bustling street markets. Learn about the city’s history and culture from your guide. In the evening, enjoy free time to explore Bangkok’s shopping districts or taste delicious Thai street food.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Free Day in Bangkok
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            This day is reserved for you to explore Bangkok at your own pace. You might choose to shop at world class malls like MBK and Siam Paragon, visit floating markets, or indulge in a relaxing Thai massage. Optional tours such as the DANONE Sadako Floating Market or Ayutthaya Historical Park can also be arranged. Spend your evening enjoying the city’s lively atmosphere.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Flight to Hanoi
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, check out from your hotel and transfer to the airport for your flight to Hanoi, Vietnam. Upon arrival, our local representative will meet and assist you with your transfer to the hotel. Spend the rest of the day exploring Hanoi’s Old Quarter, where you can sample local Vietnamese coffee and street food. Take in the city’s charm with its mix of French colonial architecture and ancient temples.

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Hanoi to Ha Long Bay – Overnight Cruise by Bus
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today you will journey by bus to the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Ha Long Bay. Upon arrival, board a comfortable cruise and enjoy a welcome drink. Sail past thousands of limestone karsts and islets, stopping to visit stunning caves and partake in activities like kayaking or swimming. Relish a delicious seafood lunch and dinner on board while soaking in the breathtaking sunset views. Spend the night on the cruise under the starlit sky.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Ha Long Bay to Hanoi by Bus
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Wake up early to witness the sunrise over the bay. Participate in a Tai Chi session on deck or enjoy some quiet moments with the serene surroundings. After breakfast, continue exploring the bay with a short boat trip or cave visit before returning to the cruise for brunch. Disembark and travel back to Hanoi by bus, checking in to your hotel for an evening at leisure.

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: Hanoi FullDay City Tour
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Begin your day with a visit to the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and the Presidential Palace. Explore the One Pillar Pagoda and the Temple of Literature, Vietnam’s first university. Visit the Vietnam Museum of Ethnology to learn about the country’s diverse ethnic groups. Conclude your day with a cycle ride through Hanoi’s Old Quarter, where you can shop for souvenirs and enjoy the vibrant atmosphere.

itinerary.title: Day 9
itinerary.description:
: Departure from Hanoi
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, check out from your hotel. Depending on your flight time, you may have some free time for lastminute shopping or sightseeing. Transfer to the airport for your departure flight, taking home unforgettable memories of Thailand and Vietnam. Our team will assist with checkin formalities to ensure a smooth departure.

title: Langtang Valley Trek – The Hidden Gem of Nepal: Complete Guide for Adventurers and Nature Lovers.
description: The Langtang Valley Trek offers a unique Himalayan experience close to Kathmandu, combining stunning mountain views with rich cultural immersion. It is less crowded than other popular treks like Everest Base Camp, making it ideal for those seeking tranquility alongside natural beauty. This trek stands out for its blend of accessible altitude, diverse landscapes, and authentic encounters with the Tamang culture, making it a hidden gem of Nepal. Walkers navigate through ancient forests, traditional villages, and sacred monasteries while enjoying a journey filled with both adventure and spiritual calm. Accessible and well-supported with teahouse accommodations, Langtang Valley Trek appeals to both beginners and experienced trekkers. Its proximity to the capital city also makes it a practical yet rewarding escape into one of Nepal’s most scenic regions.

title: Experience Everest Base Camp During Dashain Tihar Festival 2025: A Local's Guide.
description: Dashain Tihar festival creates the perfect backdrop for one of the world's most iconic treks. Autumn 2025 offers a rare opportunity to experience Nepal's vibrant cultural celebrations while conquering the trail to Everest Base Camp. During September to November, trekkers enjoy the most favorable conditions of the year. The weather becomes dry and stable in October, with clear skies providing breathtaking views of Everest, Lhotse, Ama Dablam, and other magnificent peaks. Additionally, temperatures range from a comfortable 10°C to 18°C at lower elevations like Lukla and Namche Bazaar, though they can drop to -10°C to -20°C at night at Everest Base Camp. This period also coincides with Nepal's most significant cultural events. Dashain 2025 begins on October 1st and concludes on October 15th, while Tihar in Nepal starts from October 25th and wraps up on October 29th. What makes this timing particularly special is how the festive atmosphere transforms the entire region. The country becomes vibrant and lively during these celebrations, with families coming together to honor traditions. For us trekkers, this presents a unique opportunity to witness authentic cultural practices while enjoying what many consider the best time to view the clear mountains.
